request_pathways.name: Main Line Health Authorization for Disclosure of Health Information
US Mail to HIM Department, Newtown Square, PA

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a generic system-wide 'Authorization for Disclosure of Health Information' form with a 'Patient personal use' purpose checkbox, but the form is designed primarily for third-party release.

red_flags: Prepayment language: 'payment will be expected prior to the records being delivered' could condition access on upfront payment
Witness signature line present without clarification of whether it is required
bright_spots: Six delivery options including encrypted USB, MyChart, encrypted email, and third-party portal with clear availability matrix by recipient type
Fillable PDF (form-1) with PRINT, SAVE AS, EMAIL, and RESET action buttons for digital-first workflow
'Patient personal use' as an explicit purpose checkbox normalizes patient self-access requests
Detailed signing authority guidance covering minors, incapacitated patients, and deceased patients under PA law
Separate opt-in checkboxes for sensitive information (HIV, psychiatric, substance abuse) with clear explanatory language

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — form appeared as first web search result, direct PDF link, no authentication or bot blocking required.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — form-1 has 41 fillable fields and an EMAIL button for digital completion, but submission requires fax or email rather than an integrated online portal.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with clear logical flow and helpful instructions page including delivery matrix, but some legal language density in the rights acknowledgment paragraphs prevents a 5.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the generic disclosure authorization form requires patients to fill in their own name as the 'person or institution' receiving records, and the framing is oriented toward third-party release despite the 'Patient personal use' checkbox.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing that would materially impede a patient — prepayment language is concerning but not a clear violation, response timelines and appeal rights are correctly stated, no notarization required, fee amounts not specified.

overall.summary: Main Line Health provides an easily findable, technically competent fillable form with excellent delivery options, but the generic third-party disclosure framing and prepayment language prevent it from reaching an A.
